Quotes: Only a philosophy of eternity, in the world today, could justify non-violence.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: To the Master's honor all must turn, each in its track, without a sound, forever tracing Newton's ground.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: The last proceeding of reason is to recognize that there is an infinity of things which are beyond it. There is nothing so conformable to reason as this disavowal of reason.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: There have been several Duchesses of Westminster but there is only one Chanel!
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: Fashion fades, only style remains the same.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: If the present world go astray, the cause is in you, in you it is to be sought.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quotes: Nothing exists except atoms and empty space;everything else is opinion.
Author: Democritus

Quotes: A marvel that has nothing to offer, democracy is at once a nation's paradise and its tomb.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: To want fame is to prefer dying scorned than forgotten.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: The history of mankind is the instant between two strides taken by a traveler.
Author: Franz Kafka

Quotes: When you look into an abyss, the abyss also looks into you.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Nothing is worth more than this day.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: The deed is everything, the glory is naught.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Nudity is the uniform of the other side... nudity is a shroud.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: The advantage of the emotions is that they lead us astray.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: In America the President reigns for four years, and Journalism governs forever and ever.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Everything is possible, from angels to demons to economists and politicians.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: Society therefore is an ancient as the world.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: The infinitely little have a pride infinitely great.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: The first step, my son, which one makes in the world, is the one on which depends the rest of our days.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: What's done can't be undone.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: The wheel is come full circle.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Give me my robe, put on my crown;I have Immortal longings in me.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: It is the stars, The stars above us, govern our conditions.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: The undiscovered country from whose bourn no traveler returns.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: O! for a muse of fire, that would ascend the brightest heaven of invention.
Author: William Shakespeare
